metadata.dcterms:title: Leveraging Wikipedia Table Schemas for Knowledge Graph Augmentation
metadata.dcterms:creator: Cannaviccio, Matteo
Lorenzo Ariemma
Denilson Barbosa
Paolo Merialdo
metadata.dcterms:description: General solutions to augment Knowledge Graphs (KGs) with facts extracted from Web tables aim to associate pairs of columns from the table with a KG relation based on the matches between pairs of entities in the table and facts in the KG. These approaches su er from intrinsic limitations due to the incompleteness of the KGs. In this paper we investigate an alternative solution, which lever- ages the patterns that occur on the schemas of a large corpus of Wikipedia tables. Our experimental evaluation, which used DBpedia as reference KG, demonstrates the advantages of our approach over state-of-the-art solutions and reveals that we can extract more than 1.7M of facts with an estimated accuracy of 0.81 even from tables that do not expose any fact on the KG.
metadata.dcterms:subject: Computer and Information Science
metadata.dcterms:isReferencedBy: Matteo Cannaviccio, Lorenzo Ariemma, Denilson Barbosa, and Paolo Merialdo. 2018. Leveraging Wikipedia Table Schemas for Knowledge Graph Augmentation.
